roles: teacher of English, Dutch and German
supporting_quotes: From 1968 to 1978, before dedicating his life to his political career, Michel taught English, Dutch and German in the Provincial School of Jodoigne, a rural town 25 miles from Brussels.

roles: chairman
supporting_quotes: From 1967 to 1977, Michel was chairman of the Young Liberals in the district of Nivelles.

roles: alderman
supporting_quotes: Then he became alderman in Jodoigne from 1977 to 1983

roles: secretary-general
supporting_quotes: "secretary-general" of the Parti Réformateur Libéral (PRL) political party from 1980 to 1982

roles: chairman
supporting_quotes: chairman of the PRL from 1982 to 1990 and from 1995 to 1999.

roles: representative
supporting_quotes: He was a member of the Belgian federal parliament as a representative (1978–1999).

roles: mayor
supporting_quotes: He is also the mayor of the municipality of Jodoigne in Walloon Brabant and has been since 1983.

roles: Minister of Foreign Affairs
Vice Prime Minister
supporting_quotes: Michel was the Belgian foreign minister and vice prime minister from 1999 to 2004.
In office 12 July 1999 – 18 July 2004

roles: European Commissioner for Research
supporting_quotes: In office 13 September 2004 – 21 November 2004
Michel completed Busquin's term as the European Commissioner for Science and Research

roles: European Commissioner for Development and Humanitarian Aid
supporting_quotes: In office 22 November 2004 – 17 July 2009
He served in the government of Belgium as minister of foreign affairs from 1999 to 2004 and was European Commissioner for Development and Humanitarian Aid from 2004 to 2009.

roles: member of High-level Panel on United Nations Systemwide Coherence
supporting_quotes: In 2006, United Nations Secretary-General Kofi Annan appointed him to a High-level Panel on United Nations Systemwide Coherence, which was set up to explore how the United Nations system could work more coherently and effectively across the world in the areas of development, humanitarian assistance and the environment.

roles: Member of the European Parliament
supporting_quotes: From 2009 to 2019, he was a Member of the European Parliament.
He resigned as Commissioner in July 2009 to become a Member of the European Parliament.

roles: member of Committee on Civil Liberties, Justice and Home Affairs
supporting_quotes: Throughout his time as Member of the European Parliament, Michel served on the Committee on Civil Liberties, Justice and Home Affairs.

roles: member of Committee of Inquiry into Money Laundering, Tax Avoidance and Tax Evasion (PANA)
supporting_quotes: From 2016 until 2017, he was part of the Committee of Inquiry into Money Laundering, Tax Avoidance and Tax Evasion (PANA) that investigated the Panama Papers revelations and tax avoidance schemes more broadly.

roles: co-president
supporting_quotes: In addition to his committee assignments, Michel co-presided over the ACP–EU Joint Parliamentary Assembly which advises on the orientations of co-operation policies between the EU and its partners in Africa, the Caribbean, and the Pacific.

organizations: European Parliament Intergroup on LGBT Rights
roles: member
supporting_quotes: He was also a member of the European Parliament Intergroup on LGBT Rights

organizations: European Parliament Intergroup on Extreme Poverty and Human Rights
roles: member
supporting_quotes: the European Parliament Intergroup on Extreme Poverty and Human Rights

organizations: Campaign for the Establishment of a United Nations Parliamentary Assembly
roles: member
supporting_quotes: and the Campaign for the Establishment of a United Nations Parliamentary Assembly, an organisation which campaigns for democratic reformation of the United Nations, and the creation of a more accountable international political system.

roles: member of honour committee
supporting_quotes: Michel is also a member of the Fondation Chirac's honour committee, ever since the foundation was launched in 2008 by former French president Jacques Chirac to promote world peace.

roles: Minister of State
supporting_quotes: Belgium: Minister of State, by Royal Decree of 1995.

roles: Commander in the Order of Leopold
supporting_quotes: Commander in the Order of Leopold.

roles: Knight Grand Cross in the Order of Leopold II
supporting_quotes: Knight Grand Cross in the Order of Leopold II, RD of 26 May 2014.

roles: Grand Cross of the Royal Order of the Polar Star
supporting_quotes: Sweden: Grand Cross of the Royal Order of the Polar Star

roles: Grand Cross of the Order of Infante Dom Henrique
supporting_quotes: Portugal: Grand Cross of the Order of Infante Dom Henrique

roles: Knight Grand Cross in the Order of Orange-Nassau
supporting_quotes: Netherlands: Knight Grand Cross in the Order of Orange-Nassau.

roles: Knight Grand Cross in the Order of Isabella the Catholic
supporting_quotes: Spain: Knight Grand Cross in the Order of Isabella the Catholic

roles: Knight Grand Cross in the Order of the Dannebrog
supporting_quotes: Denmark: Knight Grand Cross in the Order of the Dannebrog

roles: Knight Grand-Cross in the Order of the Star of Romania
supporting_quotes: Knight Grand-Cross in the Order of the Star of Romania.

roles: Grand Officer in the Légion d'honneur
supporting_quotes: France: Grand Officer in the Légion d'honneur

roles: Grand officer in the Order of the Pléiade
supporting_quotes: Grand officer in the Order of the Pléiade (Ordre de la Francophonie et du dialogue des cultures; that is, "Order of the Francophonie and of the dialogue of cultures")

roles: 1st Class in the Order of the Stara Planina
supporting_quotes: Bulgaria: 1st Class in the Order of the Stara Planina / The Balkan Mountains.
